channel.title: How to scare people when they log onto the computer!
channel.description:
First, you take a screenshot of your desktop with all windows closed (close all of your windows like My Computer or internet explorer/firefox etc.) then press "Print Screen" or "Prt Scr" button and go to start>all programs>accesories>paint then copy and paste and save the picture (DO NOT EDIT THE PICTURE IN ANY WAY)
then go to>my computer>Local disk ((C) (D) etc whichever is your main drive) >WINDOWS>explorer or explorer.exe
and rename Explorer.exe to something you will remember
then set the picture you just saved and set as the desktop background.
now rightclick on an open area of your desktop and go to arrange icons and click "show desktop icons" and make it unchecked.
now either log off and re-logon to test or end explorer.exe in the task manager (ctrl+alt+delete) under processes
now it will look like everything is normal, but when they click on the icons or click start...IT DOESNT WORK!!!!
to fix, go to the task manager (ctrl+alt+delete) and go to file>run/new task and type in the name of your renamed explorer.exe and click ok then click show desktop icons, and go back to My Computer>Local disk>WINDOWS and rename the renamed.exe file back to explorer and everything should run right.

item.title: How to scare people when they log onto the computer!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:5, topic:69958”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=102777.msg1039096#msg1039096 date=1174620966]
Delete HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and reboot
[/quote]
Or the whole registry for that matter.[/quote]

Then the computer wouldn’t even start :rolleyes:

Read full topic
item.source: How to scare people when they log onto the computer!

item.title: How to scare people when they log onto the computer!
item.dc:creator: @bumr055 bumr055
item.description:
@bumr055 wrote:

it would probably be more scary if they logged on and the desktop had a bunch of videos that looked like hidden cameras … ON THEM… when there at ther house and in there room and shit… that would scare me!..

a computer not responding to anything i do is not scary… just casual. lol

then go to>my computer>Local disk (© (D) etc whichever is your main drive) >WINDOWS>explorer or explorer.exe

and rename Explorer.exe to something you will remember

then set the picture you just saved and set as the desktop background.

now rightclick on an open area of your desktop and go to arrange icons and click “show desktop icons” and make it unchecked.

now either log off and re-logon to test or end explorer.exe in the task manager (ctrl+alt+delete)
under processes

now it will look like everything is normal, but when they click on the icons or click start…IT DOESNT WORK!!!

to fix, go to the task manager (ctrl+alt+delete) and go to file>run/new task and type in the name of your renamed explorer.exe and click ok then click show desktop icons, and go back to
My Computer>Local disk>WINDOWS and rename the renamed.exe file back to explorer and everything should run right.
